intro: Phemeranthus spinescens, commonly known as the spiny phemeranthus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its spiny stems and small, delicate flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink and are arranged in clusters. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
